intro: Alkanna brachysolen, commonly known as the short-hair alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers. The plant produces distinctive, orange-red root tubers that are used in traditional medicine. Its adaptability to dry conditions makes it a resilient species in its native habitat. The flowers typically bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
